Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Sakhmet
Description: This beautiful amulet in green faience was part of the Leopold II collection. The goddess Sakhmet with the head of a lioness is seated on a throne of which the lateral sides show an openwork design figuring serpents. The legs and the feet are joined. The piece is distinguished by a remarkable detail: the goddess of Memphis holds a sistrum on her knees. The musical instrument served to efface the fury of the goddess during the rites of appeasement.
